title: Smooth scroll-to-top on specific evangelism route entry

requirements.summary: Add smooth auto-scroll to window top when entering /why-jesus, /how-to-begin, /assurance-next-steps, or /connect, without affecting other routes.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /why-jesus, /how-to-begin, /assurance-next-steps, or /connect results in a smooth scroll to window top (top=0).
The smooth scroll behavior occurs when clicking the evangelism pages' internal <Link> navigation cards and when using header navigation (where applicable).
Other routes (e.g., /feed, /submit-testimony, /peace-with-god) do not gain new forced scroll-to-top behavior as part of this change.

file_operations.description: Create a small hook that observes the current router location and triggers window.scrollTo({ top: 0, behavior: 'smooth' }) only when the pathname matches the evangelism whitelist: /why-jesus, /how-to-begin, /assurance-next-steps, /connect.

Wire the evangelism-only scroll-to-top behavior into the root routing layout (e.g., RootLayout) so it triggers on route entry for the specified evangelism routes, regardless of whether navigation originated from header nav or in-page <Link> cards, and does not run for other routes.
